required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of the LMA Protector and the I-gel
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the LMA Protector and the I-gel in Anesthetized Patients.

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators aim to compare two supraglottic airway devices; the i-gel and the newly developed laryngeal mask airway protector in terms of airway sealing effect, the insertion success rate, and the incidence of complications in anesthetized patients.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At 5 min after the insertion of i-gel or LMA protector
primary_outcome.description: Oropharyngeal airway leak pressure is measured by closing the expiratory valve of the circle system at a fresh gas flow of 3 L/min and observing the airway pressure at equilibrium.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of insertion attempt for the successful placement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the insertion of i-gel or LMA protector
secondary_outcome.description: The numbers of insertion attempt for successful placement are counted.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the insertion of i-gel or LMA protector
secondary_outcome.description: Insertion time is defined as the time from picking up the device to confirming successful placement (the appearance of the ETCO2 on the monitor screen).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the insertion of i-gel or LMA protector
secondary_outcome.description: Ease of insertion is defined as follows. Easy: requiring no additional maneuver, fair: requiring 1 additional maneuver, difficult: requiring more than 1 additional maneuver.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 25 min after the insertion of i-gel or LMA protector
secondary_outcome.description: Ease of garstic tube insertion is assessed as follows; easy, difficult, impossible.

secondary_outcome.measure: The accuracy of insertion location of the device in the oropharyngeal space
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 15 min after the insertion of i-gel or LMA protector
secondary_outcome.description: After insertion of the device, the insertion location is assessed using a fiberoptic bronchoscope; 4, only the vocal cords seen; 3, vocal cords and posterior part of the epiglottis seen; 2, vocal cords and anterior part of the epiglottis seen; 1, vocal cords not seen, but adequate ventilation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Blood staining on the i-gel or LMA protector
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Immediately after removal of i-gel or LMA protector
secondary_outcome.description: After removal of the device, the presence of blood staining on the device is checked.

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence and severity of postoperative sore throat
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative sore throat is assessed using a numerical rating scale (0-100 point).

arm_group.description: After the induction of anesthesia, I-gel is inserted into the oropharyngeal space.
After the induction of anesthesia, laryngeal mask airway protector is inserted into the oropharyngeal space.

intervention.description: After the induction of anesthesia, i-gel is inserted along the palatopharyngeal curve.
After the inudction of anesthesia, laryngeal mask airway protector is inserted along the palatopharyngeal curve, and the cuff is inflated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Requirement for mechanical ventilation under general anesthesia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Surgical position other than supine position
- Tumors or anatomical abnormalities in the upper airway
- Known or predicted difficult airway
- Body mass index > 30 kg/m2
- Required postoperative mechanical ventilation
- Head and neck surgery
- Aspiration tendency

facility.name: Seoul Metropolitan Government Seoul National University Boramae Medical Center
